monogr.title: A famous and godly history : contaynyng the lyues & actes of three renowmed reformers of the Christia [n] Church, Martine Luther, Iohn Ecolampadius, and Huldericke Zuinglius. The declaracion of Martin Luthers faythe before the Emperoure Charles the fyft, and the illustre estates of the empyre of Germanye, wyth an oration of hys death, all set forth in Latin by Phillip Melancthon, Wolfgangus Faber, Capito. Simon Grineus, & Oswald Miconus, newly Englished by Henry Bennet Callesian
monogr.author: Melanchthon, Philipp

lg.l: A head where Pallas misteries wer fraight,
A face where • oumy brigh • lye dyd appeare,
An eye yt could discerne ech mynde • sleight,
And eares contēpning priuate • au • to heare
A tong that dyd pronounce the sacred truth,
A prareirs pen, that paynted well the same.
A zeale that moued Tigrish hartes to ru • he,
And could to vertue mild •• s mindes enflame
A mynde aspiring ay to wysdomes throne.
A hart that neuer drad the Tirantes might.
A rocke yt wold remoue from truth for none
Disdayning death in quarell of the ryght.
These golden gifts, in Luther shined bright
For which he now receiues immortal light.

q.p: ¶ The death of the iuste, is precious before the syght of God.
